availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Born in Kentucky around 1833. Worked as a merchant in Owensboro, Kentucky. At the outbreak of the war, joined the Confederate Army. Winstead was Commissioned Second Lieutenant in Company K, Fourth Regiment Infantry, Kentucky, CSA on September 13, 1861. He was assigned temporary command of Company B in December of 1862 and formally given the rank Captain on January 10, 1863. Winstead was wounded at Resaca, Georgia on May 14, 1864 and again at Dallas, Georgia on May 29, 1864. After recovering from his wounds, Winstead became a Provost Marshal under Provost Marshal General Martin H. Cofer.

bibl.p: The Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 150 - 151; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Daviess, Owensboro, p. 945.
